quality_assessment: Home page provides good introduction and navigation but misses several key features that would help users understand Prodigy's full capabilities

issues.description: Missing mention of checkpoint and resume capabilities, which are critical for long-running workflows
issues.fix_suggestion: Add bullet point highlighting checkpoint and resume capabilities for long-running operations

issues.description: Dead Letter Queue (DLQ) and failure handling not mentioned, which is a key differentiator for production reliability
issues.fix_suggestion: Add bullet point about automated failure recovery and DLQ for failed items

issues.description: Quick start example doesn't show workflow structure with name/mode fields
issues.fix_suggestion: Update quick start example to include minimal workflow metadata (name field) for consistency with full workflow structure

issues.description: Variables section mentions 'captured and interpolated' but doesn't highlight the comprehensive variable system with defaults, aliases, and nested field access
issues.fix_suggestion: Expand variables bullet to mention output capture formats (json, lines, number) and interpolation features

issues.description: Environment variables and secrets management not mentioned in key concepts despite being a major feature
issues.fix_suggestion: Add key concept for environment configuration including secrets and profiles

issues.description: Validation bullet is too brief - doesn't explain implementation validation vs test validation
issues.fix_suggestion: Clarify that validation includes both automated testing and implementation completeness checking

positive_aspects: Clear, concise introduction that explains what Prodigy is and why it exists
Excellent self-referential example (documentation maintained by Prodigy itself)
Good progressive disclosure - starts simple, then directs to detailed docs
Quick start example is genuinely quick and demonstrates core value
All internal links are valid and point to correct files
Navigation structure is clear with logical grouping
Highlights automated documentation as a unique feature
improvement_suggestions: Consider adding a 'Use Cases' section showing where Prodigy excels (code reviews, refactoring, documentation, testing)
Add a brief comparison or positioning statement (e.g., 'Like GitHub Actions but with AI' or 'MapReduce for code changes')
Include a visual diagram or workflow illustration in the introduction
Add a 'Why Prodigy?' section highlighting key differentiators (DLQ, checkpoints, worktree isolation)
Consider adding a success metric or testimonial if available
Link to MapReduce section earlier since it's a key differentiator

metadata.validation_focus: Check that home page provides clear introduction and navigation
